result.error_message:
CypressError: `cy.type()` failed because this element is detached from the DOM.

`<input aria-invalid="false" placeholder="Search" type="text" class="MuiInput-input MuiInputBase-input css-mnn31" value="Tea" id="mui-13">`

Cypress requires elements be attached in the DOM to interact with them.

The previous command that ran was:

  > `cy.type()`

This DOM element likely became detached somewhere between the previous and current command.

Common situations why this happens:
  - Your JS framework re-rendered asynchronously
  - Your app code reacted to an event firing and removed the element

You typically need to re-query for the element or add 'guards' which delay Cypress from running new commands.

https://on.cypress.io/element-has-detached-from-dom

    at Context.<anonymous> (https://hub.alpha.kidsloop.net/__cypress/runner/cypress_runner.js:173140:19)

Cypress requires elements be attached in the DOM to interact with them.

The previous command that ran was:

  > `cy.should()`

This DOM element likely became detached somewhere between the previous and current command.

Common situations why this happens:
  - Your JS framework re-rendered asynchronously
  - Your app code reacted to an event firing and removed the element

You typically need to re-query for the element or add 'guards' which delay Cypress from running new commands.
